SEARCH
Package the_game

Class Create

java.lang.Object
the_game.Create
public class Create extends Object
A class which creates all that is necessary for the game : walls, chests, enemies, bosses, weapons, artifacts, potions, map. Also includes the attributes of the map (dungeon) : width, length, map ID which are all accessible without a class instantiation.
Author:
Camille Girodengo

      Create an array of int arrays which contains the location of all the walls of the map except the borders.

    • placeChests

      public static Chest[] placeChests()
      Create a Chest array which contains all the chests of this map.
      All artifacts and potions in the chests are random.
      Can be upgraded to include an int parameter which would indicate which map to create (in case more maps are added to the game)
      Returns:
      a Chest array which contains all the chests of this map

    • spawBoss

      public static Boss[] spawBoss()
      Create a Boss array which contains all the bosses of this map.
      Can be upgraded to include an int parameter which would indicate which map to create (in case more maps are added to the game)
      Returns:
      a Boss array which contains all the bosses of this map

    • spawnEnemies

      public static Enemy[] spawnEnemies()
      Create a Enemy array which contains all the enemies of this map.
      Can be upgraded to include an int parameter which would indicate which map to create (in case more maps are added to the game)
      Returns:
      a Enemy array which contains all the enemies of this map

    • swapItems

      public static void swapItems(Item[] items, int index1, int index2)
      Swaps two items in an item array
      Parameters:
      items - a Item array in which to switch the two items
      index1 - the index of the first item
      index2 - the index of the second item

      public static Item[] shuffleItemArray(Item[] items)

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      a shuffled Item array

    • createMap

      public static char[][] createMap(int[][] walls, Chest[] chests, Enemy[] enemies, Boss[] bosses, Hero hero)
      Create an array of char arrays which represents the map with all the walls, chests, enemies, bosses and the hero.
      Parameters:
      walls - an array of int arrays which contains the location of all walls of the map except the borders.
      chests - a Chest array which contains the location of all the chests of the map
      enemies - a Enemy array which contains the location of all the common enemies of the map
      bosses - a Boss array which contains the location of all the bosses of the map
      hero - hero the hero and their location on the map
      Returns:
      an array of char arrays which represents the complete map of the dungeon
